titles.title: Federal Employees Clean Air Incentives Act
Federal Employees Clean Air Incentives Act
To amend title 5, United States Code, to provide for the establishment of programs to encourage Federal employees to commute by means other than single-occupancy motor vehicles.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service. H. Rept. 103-356, Part I.
Ms. Norton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote. (consideration: 11/19/93 CR S16583)

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 10/20/1993--Introduced. Federal Employees Clean Air Incentives Act - Amends Federal civil service law to provide for the establishment of programs to encourage Federal employees to commute by means other than single-occupancy motor vehicles.
